title: Great board game!
body: Fantastic game, everyone we have introduced to this game has raved about it and wanted us to bring it over to game night again and again! Highly recommended!

title: Four Stars
body: Great Game! Fun group game with lots of stratagey but a limited time frame

title: excelent
body: excelent

title: Family Fun
body: We have enjoyed quite a few games of this already.  Look forward to lots more family time with it.  Great!

title: Five Stars
body: So fun

title: Five Stars
body: Super fun game.  Need at least 3 for it to be good though

title: Five Stars
body: Excellent game for all!

title: Fun game
body: My teenage son asked for it. It was shipped quickly and we love playing it as a family.  Better than video games or TV.

title: Family fun
body: My entire family loves to play this game and when friends come over, they also ask to play. I also bought the extension pack of more travel destinations for even more routes to travel !!!

title: I don't normally like games but.....
body: This is my all-time favorite board game.  My wife loves board games and I usually don't.  So when she came home with this one, I was initially unexcited about it.  However I quickly realized that this was different.  So many strategies and easy to learn.  I liked it so much that I actually spent the $10 and bought the ipad version so as to play it alone or when I am on the road.

title: Such fun, and we're not even board game people!
body: This game is such good fun! With two people or with more, we really enjoy playing it. We aren't really board game folks, in fact we only own this one and scrabble but we bought it after playing with some friends and having a great time. For reference, we're in our late twenties and not particularly "wholesome" types who stay in all the time. We have not played with children so I don't know how this would go over with kids. It's a long game and requires some concentration, but with a few beers we played happily well into the night.

title: Great Board Game
body: This is a great game and one of my favorites.  It has enough strategy and different aspects to keep people engaged and definitely requires some thought to win.  Only 5 people can play, however, and the more people that play the longer the game takes to complete.  Two players can get through a game in 45 minutes to an hour.

title: So fun!
body: I love this game, my friends love this game, hell, my parents love this game! It's got a bit of a learning curve but once you play through your first time you'll have it down for all future plays.

title: Frustrating
body: I didn't like this game because you can make your strategy at the beginning of the game and one person can make a move that will totally stop you from succeeding. I dont like games where you cant follow your strategy through the game or that each player has one movement per turn. This was just a frustrating game for me, even when I won.

title: This is a fun and chalenging game
body: Our friend brought it over, we all played it, everyone liked it. I bought a copy and so did our friends, then I bought the app for my tablet and have fun playing it on there. My husband and I play each other on the tablet version. great game!!

title: fab family game
body: Played this game all weekend with a group of families. Great for 5 people or five teams. Very fun strategy game that you can catch on to pretty quickly.  I think anyone ages 9-10 and up could play.  Goes relatively quickly- game over in 1 - 1 1/2 hours.

title: Fun game of strategy and skill
body: This is a great game that even my kids like to pay. It includes elements of both luck and strategy, and it is one that I really enjoy playing with other adults, as well as with our kids (we do make some modifications so our 5 and 6 year olds can play along; we play with all our cards on the table so they are visible to all the other players, and we don't play for points).This is a fun, award-winning game that really is fun for the whole family (ages 8 and up; with modifications we play with ages 5 and up)

title: Great Game
body: Ticket to Ride is a great game for everyone. The only thing is only 5 or less can play at a time, unless you play in teams which we have not tried yet.

title: One of my family's favorite board games
body: A simple game of strategy which has some competitive features, without having you directly attack other players. Everyone we have played it with loves it, and we are already looking at expansions to add more variety. It is unfortunate that the game only supports 5 players, but the Asia map pack supports 6, so we will be buying that soon.

title: We love this game!
body: An awesome family game which is lots of fun for us to play.  Really enjoy it and have now purchased the expansion pack as well.

title: fun entertaining game!
body: This game is fairly easy to learn, and stays entertaining throughout. Kind of reminds me of Monopoly but without the monotony. My family loves the game (we're all ages 25 and up), its a good way to spend time together.

title: One of the best
body: A great board game that is easy to play and just a lot more fun than other spite fueled games like Monopoly.

title: Don't let the number of pieces overwhelm you- the game ...
body: Don't let the number of pieces overwhelm you- the game is extremely quick to pick up and its intensity is measured only by your playmates.

title: Simple, elegant, fun
body: This is our second TTR game as we bought the Nordic edition first.  We love TTR.  It's addictive.  The simple design and layout are so simple that anyone can learn it in about 10 minutes.  Learning strategy will take a lifetime of playing.  There are a lot of pieces and cards, so it may not be the best for small kids but I would say around 8 years old and up will enjoy this game.  If I have a criticism it would be to change the person with whom you play.  Playing the same people over and over again isn't always very interesting...but still awesome.

title: It's a great family game
body: It's a great family game, especially if there are younger player its easy to learn and fun to play. the directions are a little confusing but once you start to play it all falls in place

title: Love this game
body: Love this game! It really is a game you can plan with just about any group and have a great time. Not too thinky and not too simple. Highly recommended for any level of gamer. Use this to hook non gamers!

title: Fun game!
body: Fun & quick to learn.  Its our game for this year!  Great gift for so many ages.

title: Five Stars
body: She lived it.

title: Great game!
body: I first played Ticket to Ride with my college roommates.  I then introduced my family to the series and we are all now hooked!  All of the Ticket to Ride games are great.  The game changes each time you play, and it seems like a different game when you play with 2 or 5 players.  I would recommend this game and all of the others (including the expansion packs) in the Ticket to Ride series to anyone looking for a fun, challenging group game.

title: Five Stars
body: This is such a fun game!

title: A MUST OWN!
body: This is an amazing game.  So fun for a group or even two people.  It's a perfect game night game as it does not take an extremely long time to play, is very engaging and moves quickly.I can't say enough good things about this game!

title: Great way to spend free time
body: I have played it several dozen times since I've got this game . I love it! I'm getting expansion next time.

title: Great board game
body: My wife and I play this board game all the time. We started out playing the Video game version on the xbox. When we learnt there was an actual board game, we couldn't resist. Great with 2 people (takes about an hour to play), add about 30-45 mins per player after that. For the best explanations of gameplay goto the days of wonder website. When purchasing this board game you also get a code for the online game for free!

title: Ticket to ride board game
body: We love this game!!! So fun and just enough strategy to be fun but not difficult!  Love it as a phone app as well!

title: Could have been better.
body: I wish there was more interaction between the players. The only time you really interact with the other plays is to say,"I needed that route!".It really seems like all the players are playing their own game and then just compare scores at the end to see who won.

title: One of our new favorite games.
body: We got hooked on this game and every time we take it to a game night with friends that have not played it before, they buy it as well.  The only drawback is that there is a player limit of 5 which limits us when we have two other couples over for game night.

title: Love it!
body: My husband loves this game! He wants to play it anytime people come over and we always have fun. Great Buy!

title: A bit complicated to learn, but fun once you've figured it out
body: The rules say this is for 8 and up, but I find it hard to believe that a bunch of 8 year olds could sit down and make sense of the initially very complicated rules for this game. It took me and my 16 yo daughter a while (15-20 minutes?) to get through the rules and figure out just exactly how the game works.However once that's out of the way, the game is very engaging, fun, and different from anything we've played before. I do recommend it for families and for something unique and different from the usual board game fare.

title: Five Stars
body: I purchased this game as a wedding gift.  The couple was so excited to have their own game.

title: Great enjoyable game
body: Was shipped quickly and with no damage. Was packaged well.  The game is a family favorite my 7 and 9 year old ask to play often.

title: Love this game
body: The game is kinda easy but yet interesting. Good time spent with the family - we played it several times in 2 weeks and it has not annoyed us yet.

title: Great game that involves strategy
body: This game is fun and high quality.My 7 year old picked it up fast, my wife loved it, and her grandpa did too.You can be as strategic as you wish to be, or you can just play "through the motions".Want to ruin someone's plans? Go ahead. Want to focus on yourself? Go ahead.The board is pretty large, so you'll want a decent amount of room (or to play on the floor).It's definitely a game worth being added to your collection.

title: Awesome game!
body: This game is an absolute favorite in my family! We play it all the time. It was totally work the splurge!

title: Amazing game
body: I would give this game ten stars if I could. Very fun and engaging. We play it all the time.

title: Fun game
body: Fun family game, got it for my 10 yr old for Christmas last year on a whim, and the whole family loves to play.  Any game that can get the family together gets 5 stars!.

title: Great family game
body: This is a great game. Our family really enjoys playing this and it has become a go- to game in our house.

title: very fun, family game
body: I wish I could rate this 10 stars...very fun,  family game.

title: Five Stars
body: Really fun game to play with 2 or more people!  Can be intense but still easy to learn!

title: Waaaay too complicated for a family board game.
body: This game was highly touted in the publicity I read about it.  However, it too forever to even get the game set up, not to mention trying to understand the complexity of play.  It was waaay too complicated and waaaaay too expensive.

title: review
body: The game is a lot of fun. It teaches you about the rail system without making you realize you are learning.

title: Great family game.
body: We play this with our 9 and 7 year olds. I was worried at first that it might be too complicated but after a round or two everyone was strategizing and really getting into it. A favorite at our house now.

title: Other than that the game is great.
body: Long time to process an ship.  Other than that the game is great.

title: Fun
body: Kid likes it a lot. To help learning curve, there are 'How to Play' videos on YouTube that help a lot. Paying time is about 1 hour which is good for younger kids.

title: favorite board game
body: This is my favorite board game.  You have to try and collect sets of colored train cards in order to put your plastic trains down and complete your route.  Since other people are trying to complete their routes, it sometimes ends up being a race to get the good route spot first.  A very fun game!

title: Love it!!
body: We had played this game a couple years ago & loved it. So when it came up while searching for gifts this year I had to get it. It Ian more expensive than most board games but it will last a long time.

title: One of the best board games ever!
body: This is one of the 4 pillars of Euro board games, to quote Wil Wheaton.After seeing him play it on Table Top on youtube I went and bought it for our board game night we have with our friends. Everyone loves it. Super simple to learn, amazing replay value!Thinking about getting an expac or 2!

title: Awesome Game
body: This game is simple to learn and fun to play.  Every game the strategy is different since you have to fulfill different tickets.  It is one of my favorites.

title: Fun, intellectual game!
body: This game has a lot of strategy involved.  The rules may seem complicated at first, but they will quickly become second nature, so don't worry!  It is a fun combination of Monopoly, Settlers of Catan, and Risk.

title: Great Game!
body: So much fun. We have bought this game for ourselves and everyone in our family. So much fun. Only 5 players can play.

title: Must buy
body: I put this as  amuse buy for board game players, after watching the TableTop episode about this game I went right out and bought it to play with friends, if you're on the fence about buying this game watch this video [...] It'll explain the rules, the fun, and the intrigue, also if you don't laugh then the whole joy of social interaction is lost on you.

title: Simple and fun. modern day classic
body: For those of you who are interested in playing a boardgame, but have really no experience in playing them, this is a great start. Anyone over the age of six or so should not have a problem sitting down and enjoying this beautiful and sleek game.The mechanics are very easy. Collect cards with train cars of the same color to buy enough train cars to cover a route. If there is five blue spaces you need five blue train cards. It really is that simple. There are some wild cards and destination cards that add a bit to the variety, but the what makes this game fun is it's simplicity. Grandparents to grand children can all sit around the table and enjoy this one. My wife and I play and she loves the fact that she can beat the snot out of me in this game.

title: Best Family game!
body: I love this game!!  We play this with our 3 kids.  The youngest is 8 and she understands it and has a great time.  We also play it with just adults - always have a great time.  Not many games that can be for kids and adults.  Best board game I've played by far!

title: Four Stars
body: Fun social game, kinda limited in strategy.  Good was to sit around with friends and talk though.

title: Five Stars
body: Great fun family game.

title: Five Stars
body: Wit was a gift and loved it

title: one of our favorite games now
body: Came in a lot sooner than I expected! one of our favorite games now!

title: Fantastic Game
body: Great game and very easy to learn yet provides something new and exciting every time you play it. I highly recommend getting this game, it is truly worth the money.

title: Great game!
body: Bought this game as a gift.I originally got addicted to the iPhone version of this game, and thought this board-game version might be worth a try.Needless to say, my boyfriend and I adore this game. He has memorized all of the game routes, so I'll be buying the expansion pack soon.Very expensive game, but definitely worth the cost!

title: Excellent game
body: This game is a lot of fun once you learn how to play. I gave this present to my 6 year old grandson and he loves it. The beauty of this game is you can buy additions to keep it exciting.

title: Fun for Adults too!
body: My husband and I are in our 20's and we enjoy playing this game with other friends our age.  There's some strategy, but it's not as cut-throat as Settlers of Catan or Risk, which makes for a more light-hearted social game.  There are multiple strategies you can use to win.  Highly reccommend for adults and kids alike!

title: Great family game
body: We received this game for Christmas, and have played it several times since.  My seven year old really enjoys it, and the adults do as well.  The game is easy to learn and is set up so that you never really know who has won until the end.  The different 'destinations' everyone is trying to reach really spreads the game out at the beginning, and allows for different strategies.  I like how different it is every time you play, and also that it doesn't take hours to finish.  It also is more of a thinking game than a aggressive game, and it has a nice pace to it.  We have found that a game lasts around 45 minutes.The only complaint I have is that it take a while to add up the points at the end, and it is very easy to make mistakes.  The game is structured so that longer tracks have a much larger reward, but it means adding up a lot of odd numbers.  There is a numbered area at the edge of the board to keep track as you go, but it is easy to forget a track, so you really need to add it all up after.

title: great game
body: Great game play and makes a great family game. This game is super fun. Not hard to learn to play.

title: Love Love Love this game.
body: We love this game. Instructions are a little confusing at first, but once we started playing we couldn't stop. Probably best for age 10 and up.

title: Great competitive game
body: My friends and I are avid gamers. We love Catan, Munchkin, Pandemic, Dominion, and now Ticket to ride. It ranks up there. It's a lot less interactive, but a good competitive game to change up our scene. Blocking people's paths and taking the color trains your opponent is trying to collect will open up the dialog.

title: Educational
body: I got this game, in part, to helps 5th grader with his geography skills.  It is definitely going to achieve that, but it does take awhile to play with kids.  Plan on about 90 min. Instead of the 30-60 that it says on the box.  Good game though.  My 2nd grader loved it .

title: Fun Game
body: This is a fun game, but it takes a while to play it. You'll need to play it once to get all the rules and understand the strategies.

title: Three Stars
body: My grans and their friends love it.  MM

title: Fun!
body: This is a game that presents a good mental challenge as well as there being a degree of luck. As a result everyone is happy.

title: Thats what my boy wanted BUT...
body: Great game according to my two boys, 9 and 12 BUT after we opened the box we found out that there were some missing pieces for the game... too bad and the kids were disappointed ...

title: This game is amazing. It is super fun and has all of ...
body: This game is amazing.  It is super fun and has all of the building and some of the feel of monopoly with what feels like less random chance and crippling random 1-of turns.  Though there is a strong element of chance, I feel that a skilled player with a solid plan can still win fairly consistently.  Plus, the fact that my wife and 7 year old picked this up in no time made it that much more enjoyable.  Not only that, but everyone has a relatively fair chance at winning despite different skill levels, which is a testament perhaps to the luck of the tickets, but even that you have some control over.

title: Five Stars
body: This game is really fun for all ages

title: Recipient loved it.
body: Purchased as a gift. Recipient loved it.

title: Absolutely Awesome!!
body: Great Family game!! Whole family loves it!! Got it for Christmas & played it everyday for 3 wks!! Then at least every week since!! Whole Heartedly Recommend!! You will be glad you did!!

title: Five Stars
body: A fun game! It shipped quickly. I would buy again as agift.

title: Fun for the whole family!
body: Fun challenging game for the whole family!  Purchased this as a family gift under the Christmas tree.  We have a 16 year old, a 14 year old, and a 10 year old.  It was challenging and easy enough for us to play again and again.  I

title: Believe the Hype
body: I'm on a board game kick especially after Table Top.... I'm an avid Catan player... I just picked up Dead of Winter (excellent game), Last night on earth, Flash Point, Pandemic, 7 Wonders (not a fan), Love Letter, Munchkin... and after rave reviews and making it to the must own / have list now Ticket to Ride.With the games mentioned above... the issue that happens are rules... most games there are a lot of rules. They become difficult to remember and basically you end up playing and winning or losing incorrectly. Not Ticket to Ride... it took about 5 - 10 minutes to fully understand the game and after a couple of moves you totally get the game. Super fun, easy to play and there are strategic / gambles that you make.... like how long do you gamble on a route? What routes are other people doing? Can you stop them or should you hold out for that one color train card!?!

title: Awesome game!
body: Such a fun game!

title: Five Stars
body: Love all the Ticket to Ride games --have all except the Halloween

title: Great game
body: Great game, lots of fun. I even simplified the rules and had my 4 year old playing. Really a lot of fun even with some novice game players

title: Fun game, neat concept
body: Who knew building train tracks would be fun?  In this game you have to build tracks around the US and secure the routes that you draw on your cards.  Its really fun to try to build your routes, and once you get 4 players involved the competition factor really ramps up because you will all be going for those middle spots.  Not much coop factor here unfortunately, but still makes a fun family game with no too much fighting or rule book checking.

title: Fun strategy game!
body: Great game: very quick turns, quick to learn, real strategy required.  Calculating scores at the end takes a few minutes, but makes game play easier.  Definitely worth trying.

title: Buy It!!
body: My family loves this game!  It is the first game of choice whenever we get together plus two of my adult daughter's own the game too.  I will probably buy the expansion set soon so that it will be challenging.  Kids pick up this game quickly and can learn a little geography along the way.

title: Fun game. It's now our go-to present for kids ...
body: Fun game.  It's now our go-to present for kids birthday parties.

title: Best game ever!!!
body: We literally play this game every night.  It is the perfect family board game, from 2-5 players (we find the 4 or 5 works best).

title: Love it
body: I loved the game. It's very brilliant. A bit complicated at first but once you get it, it's a lot of fun. I played it with my son and he didn't like it much as it needs a lot of patience.

title: Five Stars
body: The whole family loves this game!  I can see us trying the other versions sometime in the future.

title: Nice game, but not very challenging.
body: Bought it because my wife and play a lot of games together.  It has a lot of hipe.It is interesting and some fun, however not very challenging for us (age in 70's).  Maybe better for group play than for two.

title: Great Family Game--Easy to Learn
body: I am addicted to this game. My 12 year old even downloaded the Ipad app so he could play online. My 16 year old also enjoys it. This is easy to learn, fun to play, and doesn't get boring over time. For anyone who enjoys board games (and everyone should enjoy some "old fashioned" fun once in a while), this is perfect to add to your collection.

title: AWESOME
body: My son brought this game home from college.  We played it all summer, when he left for college with the game I immediately ordered it from Amazon!  Its strategic, fun, competitive, an overall family fun game!

title: Great game
body: This is great for 2 to 5 players, multi age. My whole family (from Grandparents to younger kids love it! Easy to learn.

title: Highly recommonded!
body: I am in love this game!If you are buying this for kids then, I don't think they'll able to understand it very quickly or efficiently. You may have to change the rules to make it easier. But if it is for a couple or to play with you group of friends, trust me and buy this one! Yeah it's a little cosly when compared to few other board games but I thinks it's worth it. It is so much fun!

title: Great family gift
body: I gave this game to my daughter, her husband, and their children (5 and 8) for Christmas.  The five year old needs help playing, but the eight year old quickly grasped the concepts and began strategizing her play.  We adults loved it, also--a challenging game that lets the whole family participate.  A game can be completed in an hour to ninety minutes, and offers the opportunity to learn about geography and history while having fun.  The elements of the game (plastic railroad cars, playing cards, and scoring tokens) can be a bit overshelming, so it is important to stay  organized.

title: Five Stars
body: Very fun game. The more the better. Not very long either, maybe an hour.

title: Great game
body: Absolutely great game.  If you like Settlers you will love this game.  Easy to learn but lots of  complex strategy.

title: Fun for many different people!
body: A fun, simple game with depth for those who play it often.  Great game!

title: This board game is absolutely amazing! It feels like a mix between carcassonne and ...
body: This board game is absolutely amazing! It feels like a mix between carcassonne and Settlers of Catan. This is a definite good buy.

title: Five Stars
body: Fun game with the family!

title: Lots of fun!
body: Having a blast!

title: Five Stars
body: Fantastic game!

title: Ticket To Ride Game
body: This is a great game.  We have played it constantly since we've given it to the family for Christmas.  Other family members bought it after playing it with us.

title: Fun game.
body: Very simple and fun game.  I thought it would be more complicated but it really is not.  They say the best things in life are simple, this game is simple.

title: Awesome Game, Great for the Family! - Only Two Very Small Issues
body: This is one of the greatest games ever made. Perfect for my family because it's easily learned, has some strategy and is fun. We had to search around the net to find answers to two questions not clearly explained in the instructions, and an inner corner of the board is peeling slightly, but those are very minor issues.I'm planning to get very comfortable with the game and then buy the 1910 expansion pack. Then we should be all set for many years to come.

title: Fabulous Game!
body: This is one of our most favorite games.  It is the perfect amount of strategy and fun.  It also doesn't take as long as other games so you don't get tired of it. We have multiple versions of this and love all of them.

title: Ticket to fun!
body: Awesome game, I even accidentally laid on the box and it was fine after my 265 pounds!  Lots of fun, a good mixture of luck and strategy.  Just be careful playing, I blocked my wife's friends route and now she hates me haha!

title: love it love it love it
body: Something about this game really draws me in! I could play this game every night and never lose interest. Every game is different. Every game takes skill and strategy and not just luck. Part of what I like about this game is the quality of the design. The instructions, the inserts, on down to the box it comes in are beautiful. When I'm playing the game it makes me feel like I'm actually building real-life train tracks ... this is probably aided by the introduction to the game where it tells about rich old friends meeting once each year and betting on who could get to a certain destination cheapest and fastest ... or something like that. I would recommend this game to anyone. It's challenging, pretty, and fun.

title: Five Stars
body: So happy to have a game we can all enjoy at all ages!

title: Great game
body: I love this game! Everything game in mint condition and no missing pieces.The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because it only comes with 5 game pieces, which is a super weird amount considering most people play games in couples or pairs of people. I would of preferred 6 game pieces.

title: Five Stars
body: Awesome game, the whole family enjoys playing.

title: Four Stars
body: I love this game. :)

title: You won't be disappointed
body: This is a "stinkin' fun" group game!  You use some strategy, but not so much that you can't enjoy each other's company and visit.

title: Great family game
body: Engaging game with a combination of strategy and luck. Takes 30-60 minutes to play. Great family game.

title: Great game!
body: Always a lot of fun with the family. We want to get every extention pack!

title: My family loves Ticket to Ride
body: We purchased this game as a family Christmas present, and we all absolutely love it!. My teenage son and I are more experienced players, but my wife and 6 year old daughter haven't played many games prior to this. Now my daughter asks almost every day if we can play Ticket to Ride. I would recommend this game to everyone, regardless of whether or not they have prior gaming experience.

title: Five Stars
body: great game for middle age kids - boys especially

title: family favorite
body: The whole family loves this game!!!

title: Five Stars
body: finally at a price I can afford~

title: Five Stars
body: Great family game.

title: Five Stars
body: Good

title: what a great game no much of a learning curve directions are ...
body: what a great game no much of a learning curve directions are easy to understand played it after we got it about 1 hour lots of fun all 5 of us can't wait to play it again!

title: Cards too small
body: I would have given it 5 stars if the cards were not so small.  You have to buy a $20 "expansion" pack which has the full-size cards.The game itself is fun.

title: Glad I Got a Ticket
body: I could play this game for days. Easy to pick up and fun for groups of 2-5.

title: Five Stars
body: Love to play this version game as well as the others.  It has been a family favorite.

title: Clean family fun
body: Why not teach your children about planning and strategy while having fun with them. Enjoyed by children and adults.

title: A lot of fun!
body: Very addictive game! A lot of fun!

title: but I would recommend this for children starting around 7-8
body: This game is addictive! Everyone loves it. My eight-year-old begged me to buy it. Now I see why. My kindergartener can't stick with the game yet, but I would recommend this for children starting around 7-8. Game time lasts at least 30 minutes.

title: great game
body: Wonderful family game! I love this game well worth the buy, but can get expensive if you get addicted. You start buying the expansion which are not cheap.Thought this game itself stand alone is awesome in itself. The only cons were that the cards are small and not really managable and the quality of the cards are okay. The Ticket to Ride Europe is better quality and the cards are normal size. If you have issues with stress do not play the game it has you at the edge of your seat hoping for the right card and sweating to make the right decision. Great fun with the family!

title: Love this game
body: Played it at a friend's house and loved it enough to order it for ourselves.  Its really easy to learn and doesn't take a whole lot of time (30 min to an hour for 3 people depending on well you know the rules).  Everyone else we've played it with loves it as well.

title: Great game!
body: This is one of a few 5 player games and it is so fun!!  It's always hard to find something my whole family can play.  It is a very easy concept, but makes planning and thinking ahead fun.  I would totally recommend this as a great family game!

title: Family game
body: We play this game at least once a month. My boyfriend and I are super competitive. We love this game.

title: recommend for board game lovers and those family nights!
body: Awesome game even for 2.

title: A Game That Should Be On Everyone's Shelf!
body: What can be said that has not been said before?  This is a modern classic that deserves to be in every families' home.  It features simple rules, great strategy, and quality construction.  It offers a wonderful risk reward system that makes every game feel a little different and will vary depending on who you are playing with.Grab a copy of Ticket To Ride and a copy of Carcassonne and expect to be entertained for countless nights with your friends and family.This is the new generation's Monopoly.

title: I read review that this was a fun game. When I opened it
body: I read review that this was a fun game. When I opened it, I was hesitant to think this was a good game. We played the game and it really is fun. Can't wait to play it again.

title: we bought this brand new and were disappointed that we were missing pieces
body: We were so excited about ordering this game.....we ordered it and got it in the mail....we opened up the box and the green marker that keeps were your points are wasnt in the box....we bought this brand new and were disappointed that we were missing pieces

title: Fun game, easy to learn and play
body: My family really loves this game. It will be a frequent feature of our game nights! Very easy to learn.

title: Quick to pick up & supports range of player numbers
body: I have played this game with both moderate sized groups and as a two player.  As you know good 2 player games are hard to find and may not adapt well to multiple players.  This game does well on both counts.The play experience changes considerably with every player you add.  I enjoy it best with 3+ players.  Turns go quickly and you can play a 2 person game in under 30 minutes.This game is easy to learn and explain, so it's ideal for adding a new player and for playing with older children.One thing I enjoy about this game is that there is very little dependence on "luck".  You have the opportunity to make many decisions on each turn and these are what shape the game.  No dice!Strongly recommend for anyone looking for a game that is engaging but not too intense.

title: I.love.this.game.
body: Ticket to Ride is, simply put, an awesome game.  The game requires a bit of time to get the hang of, but after a few plays it becomes a favorite.  My favorite part of the game is that it requires thought but doesn't require all day to play.  On average, you can expect to play for 45 minutes to an hour per game.  That means you can get several games in on game night with a break for dinner!

title: Thanks Tabletop for the suggestion
body: After watching TableTop I purchased this game to get my boys off electronics. This game is great and easy to play , my 5 year old plays this game and has a blast every time

title: Five Stars
body: Such a fun family game. This is one of our favorites to play on family game night.

title: Great Board Game For The Entire Family!
body: "Ticket To Ride" will be a classic for a long time to come.  The game is pretty simple to play, it plays fast and easily accessible.  The rules are easy to learn, but there is enough strategy to make it challenging and fun.I consider myself a pretty advanced board gamer.  I love games that are complex and have many pieces ("Arkham Horror" is my favorite board game ever), and while "Ticket To Ride" is much more simple, I still really enjoy it.  A great game to play with the family or with couples who may not (yet!) be that into board games.  A good "gateway" game, if you will.

title: If you don't own it, but it now.
body: I was surprised by how much I enjoy this game. My wife and I bought Ticket to Ride after watching Wil Wheaton's TableTop. We've played it with 2 through 5 players and have enjoyed every game. Another must have for any board gamer.

title: Five Stars
body: A great game that can help to introduce kids and people less comfortable with gaming into tabletop gaming.

title: Five Stars
body: Came quick as expected and is great

title: What a blast
body: My wife and I enjoy games -- usually more of the thinking kind -- risk, scrabble, etc.  This game kept popping up, so I gave it a shot.  You can learn it in 5 minutes, but it is a blast.  Lots of strategy (which I am still ironing out) and a enough luck to change things up every time you play.  I would definitely recommend the 1910 expansion pack, though!

title: Fun game. The instructions were hard to follow so ...
body: Fun game.  The instructions were hard to follow so we watched a how to on YouTube and then had a blast.

title: Awesome!
body: Really fun game.  Wish more could play as we have 7 in our family but we team up and it is still fun to play!

title: Best game ever
body: I spend many hours playing this game with my friend. Its fun

title: best game
body: Though just purchased last month, this is by far our favorite game.  Even my 7 year old son loves this game, though he prefers the card game version because he can't get his routes blocked.  Simple to learn (5 minutes to figure out), but every game is complicated due to competition for routes and constant recalculating of routes.

title: Great family game
body: Fun to play. Great fir the whole family.

title: Great game!
body: Love this game! Keeps my family occupied on otherwise boring days! My father-in-law is reluctant to try new games, but once we got him to play one round, he's hooked on it!

title: Loved this game
body: Loved this game.  All ages can play it.  My 9 year old granddaughter understood the game as well as anyone.

title: Five Stars
body: if you like games like Settlers or 7 wonders you will enjoy this simpler game

title: Very fun game to play.
body: This is an outstanding game that is also a teacher/learning tool. The original (small) cards are too small to use, which is why we bought the "expansion.

title: Fun game.
body: Added bonus...it helps your kids learn where major cities are in the US. As you play more, you learn more strategy and so does your friends and family.  Never the same game twice.

title: So much FUN!!!
body: This game is great for the whole family. You will definitely want to purchase the expansion pack though. Makes for a lot more possibilities in the game and for us folks who have trouble seeing small print, the bigger cards are especially nice. Our family enjoys playing this game so much we have made it a regular weekly event! Thank you to all of the people who wrote reviews for this product; they were very helpful and guided me in my decision to purchase as a gift for my granddaughter.

title: Great for young and old. 2 person mega game is our favorite.
body: BEST GAME EVER. This was actually the last board game I played with my Dad before he passed away. I will always play it thinking of him and his model train set that he loved. A great game for young and old, we will play it for years to come.My husband and I love to play a 2-player mega game, where we each choose two colors of trains and play until we run out of ticket cards or trains. Definitely more fun than a short 2 person game. We use the rules like there are 4 people and see who can have the longest continuous route. Great with a cold beer and a good classic movie.

title: gift
body: I purchased this as a gift.  This game takes a bit of practice to understand but is fun.  Very fair price too!

title: very fun game. enjoyed with family many
body: very fun game.  enjoyed with family many times

title: more fun than you can shake a stick at!
body: oh man! We played this game at Comicon last summer..and decided we were getting it for Christmas! So far we have played about 6 games! and we love it! everyone can figure out how to play in one game! and then they want MORE!  sooo much fun!

title: Kind of like a nascar race
body: The game just isn't my cup of tea, it takes too long to get interesting.  Kind of like a nascar race, the first 3/4ths don't seem to matter, but the last bit is where it gets more fun.

title: Five Stars
body: This game is awesome!

title: Addicted!
body: We're addicted to this game since we got it.  Lots of fun & never boring.  Our kids hear the sound of the train playing pieces being distributed and they come running.

title: Love it!
body: I played this one time at a friend's house and I was hooked.  Bought my own 2 days later.  I even play by myself to practice nearly every night.  Love it!

title: Fun Game
body: The kids like it.  Even their Dad, who doesn't like Settler of Catan, loves this game.  Great family fun together!

title: Five Stars
body: This is a great family game--fun for all ages  Easy scoring,  challenging, fun!

title: One of my most favorite games. It's easy to learn
body: One of my most favorite games.  It's easy to learn, different, and has a perfect combo (imo) of strategy and luck.

title: Great Game!
body: My wife will actually play this game with me!  It's not really for just 2 people, since there isn't a whole lot of competition to get the tracks you want, but it's still a good time, I've heard of playing a third person between the two of you, for extra competition/fun, but we have yet to do it, it's fine with just the 2 of us.

title: Great game!
body: This game is great fun, and it is easy to teach new people how to play. When I hang out with a group of friends, I always bring this game with me. It is not incredibly long, and yet it is not incredibly easy either, so it can be replayed. I also like that it can be played with only 2 players, as my husband and I are generally alone most of the time, and it is hard to find a really good 2 player game.

title: This is an awesome game
body: This game is really awesome as the rule are really simple but the play overflows with strategies.With two players is even harder than 5 as we can build only one way between 2 cities.It is also a good way to learn the geography in the country.

title: Four Stars
body: One of the top games for beginner gamers.

title: Great Game
body: I like games that kids can play with adults, but adults can enjoy too.  When my kids were little, I didn't ever "let them win" so it was important to find game that they were able to win.  I've played this with my 12 year old grandson and he was competitive.  We took it along to a family reunion that was all adults and it was enjoyed by 3 generations -- ages late 20's to mid 80's.  Not many games cover that range and still require some strategy.  This one is a winner.

title: Great game!
body: This is a great game. I can see how the more you play it, the better you can get at it. I like it because although it does involve some luck, there is also strategy involved.

title: Five Stars
body: My whole has had so much fun playing this game.

title: Ticket to Ride game
body: My 8 year old granddaughter got this for Christmas and she loves it  She said "good job grandma"  I received the game in good time and condition  Thanks!!

title: GREATEST GAME EVER!
body: I have never left a review for a product on Amazon after being a customer for years.  That being said, this is the most fun family game we've ever played.  I have many children and have purchased many games over the years but none come close the entertainment this game has provided.  Don't let the $50 price tag scare you away as it almost did me.  If your looking for a great way to spend some quality family time you won't go wrong here.

title: Easy to learn, fun to play
body: I brought a bunch of friends over to play board games and none of them had even heard of this.  Within only a few minutes, they all fully understood the game and a couple of them are planning to buy their own copies of it now.  It's a great game and worth the buy for playing with friends or family.

title: Board games make a comeback
body: Chica and I love to play games with our friends.  We started out our gaming with our all-time favorite, [[ASIN:B00005UNAX Carcassonne Game]].  We progressed from there to such games as [[ASIN:B00008URUT Puerto Rico]] and [[ASIN:B000IXS4SY Thurn & Taxis]].  This Christmas, we received Ticket to Ride and although it wasn't released by our usual favorite, Rio Grande games, we gave it a try.  What a wonderful game!  It was refreshingly easy to learn how to play but the more times we play it, the more difficult the strategy becomes.  The strategy also changes depending on how many people are playing the game.  If you are a fan of Rio Grande games, you will love this one as well.  With so many fun board game options out there, does it really matter is there is a writer's strike going on? : )

title: great game for the family
body: Nice quality, great game for the kids to play with us as a family -- they love it!  I highly recommend.

title: Five Stars
body: Great game for everyone!!

title: game night
body: this is our first choice each game night, but we are so competitive we have to be extra viligent to keep friendly to each other, one thinks you know the us states, but wait till you look at it from a different angle.  great game for teen and adults alike

title: Top-notch game
body: We are game players, and we adore Ticket to Ride. Even though we have it now for the iPad, the board game is the best way to play it.

title: Our Whole Family Loved It!
body: We got this for our family for Christmas and it was great. The game has a similar feel to Settlers, but isn't quite as cut-throat, so it's easier to get through a game without people feeling frustrated at each other. I can see why this game has won so many awards. I also love that it comes with three extra train pieces of each color so to account for pieces ever getting lost. The only thing we didn't like was that all the cards are very small (about 2 1/2" tall) making it very hard to shuffle them).

title: Solid game, great for pairs or a group
body: This is one of my favorite 'party' games--it's easy to learn, easy to set up (unless you're like me and have to make your pile of trains all neat and tidy), and doesn't take forever to play.The best thing about the game is the fact that you can play two ways--you can either focus on your own routes or you can play to screw other people over. And since there are so many route cards, I've never played the 'same' game twice, although it is easy to pick out some of the more popular routes once you've played the game a number of times.You will need a decent sized tabletop to play this on--we tried on a 3x6 folding table and there just isn't enough room for all the cards, trains, and the board together if you have more than 3 people playing.My only complaint is that the scoring mechanism is pretty cumbersome. Most of the time when we play, we simply wait to score everything until the end which adds a nice element of surprise.Just be careful when you're playing and don't accidentally slam your fists on the table in celebration (ala Anne Wheaton on Tabletop)--the trains move easily!

title: Five Stars
body: great family game

title: Great for kids and adults!
body: This is a great game for kids and adults alike. It is very simple to set up and instructions are clear and easy to pick up, so it is an excellent way to introduce a child to more advanced strategy games. It serves as a game that can be quickly explained and played on a games night (especially if not all guests are interested in more complex strategy games).The game board and components are beautiful. I will be looking into purchasing the other versions in the future!

title: Great game
body: I was very skeptical of this game because it looked boring.  Bought it for my Grandson based on the good reviews.  He loves it and says it is the best game EVER.

title: Five Stars
body: Good game,

title: First time playing was overwhelming even after watching video etc....
body: Purchased to do with my 8 yr old son who loves trains.  We were overwhelmed by initial set up and figuring out what we are supposed to do. We never completed the game. There were 3 of us, two adults and my son to play.  We will try again another time.

title: Fun Game
body: We haven't played this game yet, but our son-in-law requested it for Christmas. We will be playing it very soon.

title: Lots of Family Fun
body: I purchased this as a family gift for Christmas.  We played it on Christmas Day and twice since then.  It is easy to learn and fun to play.  My children enjoyed it as well as the adults in our home.  I think the age rating is right on. Anyone under 8 would have a hard time playing this game.  Worth the money!

title: Five Stars
body: Great game. Hours of fun for several people.
